div.l: To bed he goth and with him goth his wif
As any Iay he liȝt was and iolif
So was here ioly whistill so wel I wet
The cradell at hir beddes feet is I set
To rokken and to yeue the childe souke
And whan dronken all was in the crouke
To bed went the douȝter riȝt anon̄
To bed goth Aleyn and also Iohn
There is namore him nedeth no dwale
The Miller hath so bibbed Ale
That as an hors he snorteth in his slepe
Ne of his taile behinde he took no kepe
His wif bar a burdon̄ a ful strong
Men miȝt her routyng here a forlong
The wenche routeth eke ꝑpar companye
And the clerk that herd this melodie
He roked Iohn and seide slepest thou
Herdest thou euer swilk sang or now
Loo swilk a coupling is betwix hem alle
A wilde fire on her bodies falle
Who herkened euer swilk a ferly thing
Ye they shal haue the flour of euil ending
This lang niȝt ther tides me na rest
But no force al sal be for the best
For Iohn seide he as euer mot I thryue
If that I may yon wenche wol I swyue
Som esement hath lawe shapen vs
For Iohn ther is a lawe that seith thus
That if a man in o point be agreued
That in an othir he shal be releued
Oure corn̄ is stolen sotheli it is no nay
And we han had an yuel fit to day
And syn I shal haue non amendement
Agein my losse I will haue esement
